newsitem.title: USA: Export agent details Pakistani wheat purchase.
newsitem.headline: Export agent details Pakistani wheat purchase.

text.p: Pakistan on Monday bought 135,000 tonnes of U.S. soft white wheat and 180,000 tonnes of Australian white wheat for February 1-28 arrival, its U.S. export agent said.
The deal included 10,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat at $150.90 a tonne, 10,000 tonnes at $150.97 and 10,000 tonnes at $151.77, all from Continental Grain.
It bought 10,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat at $150.90 and another 10,000 tonnes at $151.09 from United Grain.
The purchase also had 20,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat at $150.96, 20,000 tonnes at $151.36 and 20,000 tonnes at $152.44 all from Cargill Inc.
From Columbia Grain, Pakistan bought 10,000 tonnes at $151.85 and 15,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat at $152.22.
From Australia, it bought 45,000 tonnes from Nichimen Corp at US$155.30 a tonne, 90,000 tonnes from Cargill at US$156.285 and from Citic Australia Food, 45,000 tonnes of wheat at US$156.285.
